messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Idaho Bound! ...Anybody?
messages.msgSnippet: You might want to go to the web site for Holt Associates at http://www.gws.com   and order the 2002 Directory, which is included in the
messages.messageBody:
You might want to go to the web site for Holt Associates at
http://www.gws.com <http://www.gws.com/> and order the 2002 Directory,
which is included in the last issue of GWS. The Directory lists families and
organizations by location, and readers leaned pretty heavily towards
unschooling.

Id tell you how many listings are there for Idaho, but Ive misplaced the
issue.

The Directory is something I think people will miss, now that GWS is no more
(see the thread titled Growing Without Schoolings Demise, on
unschooling.coms Message Boards, for more on this).

Elsa Haas


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Idaho Bound! ...Anybody?
messages.msgSnippet: I m near Butte.  We re the only unschoolers for fifty miles.  I can t believe you actually found a group.  I m so envious! Montanaunschoolers@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
I'm near Butte. We're the only unschoolers for fifty miles. I can't
believe you actually found a group. I'm so envious!
Montanaunschoolers@yahoogroups.com
You can read the description and see if it might meet your needs.
Welcome! in advance if you decide to join. There are members in Great
Falls, Helena, Big Fork, Billings, Bozeman. Maybe you're already near
some.
Deb L

messages.messageBody:
Hi! I'm new this list and just saw that you are from MT. Where abouts??
That's where I am. What is the "list" that you are talking about? ;-) I
actally am in an unschooling group here that I find to be extremely helpful
and encouraging to me and my children!
thanks in advance for the info.
Rachel

> Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Idaho Bound! ...Anybody?
messages.msgSnippet: I m in Montana, but I think I know someone who s unschooling here now who is from Idaho.  Did you understand any of that?  I ll ask if she has any information
messages.messageBody:
I'm in Montana, but I think I know someone who's unschooling here now who
is from Idaho. Did you understand any of that? I'll ask if she has any
information for you.
If you don't find any nice unschoolers in Idaho you can join our MT list.
Not to many of us but we keep each other sane. Is religion an issue for
you? We have some Christians, some Wiccans, some ? . Altogether a very
fine bunch of folks.
There's a mom in Oregon on our MT list. What the hey?
Deb L

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Carla" <wingingit@e...> wrote:
> Hello All!
>
> My name is Carla & I am a chronic lurker (Well, not anymore). I
have
> 3 kids (near 7, 4 & 1 1/2). I am moving to Northern Idaho next year
&
> am trying to find other Idaho homeschoolers to correspond with. I
> have been searching for groups, but not had much success. Do any
of
> you live in Idaho -OR- can give me some leads to groups in the
> state? I prefer an inclusive/eclective group.
>
> Also, any information or opinions on living there would be much
> appreciated. I am from California & have read accounts of
newcomers
> not being welcomed. Any truth to this? I am encouraged after
reading
> about what a homeschool friendly state it is (at least the laws
> appear to be).
>
> Please, any info welcomed. Feel free to e-mail me privately.

messages.subject: Idaho Bound!
messages.msgSnippet: Hello All! My name is Carla & I am a chronic lurker (Well, not anymore). I have 3 kids (near 7, 4 & 1 1/2). I am moving to Northern Idaho next year & am trying
messages.messageBody:
Hello All!

My name is Carla & I am a chronic lurker (Well, not anymore). I have
3 kids (near 7, 4 & 1 1/2). I am moving to Northern Idaho next year &
am trying to find other Idaho homeschoolers to correspond with. I
have been searching for groups, but not had much success. Do any of
you live in Idaho -OR- can give me some leads to groups in the
state? I prefer an inclusive/eclective group.

Also, any information or opinions on living there would be much
appreciated. I am from California & have read accounts of newcomers
not being welcomed. Any truth to this? I am encouraged after reading
about what a homeschool friendly state it is (at least the laws
appear to be).

Please, any info welcomed. Feel free to e-mail me privately.
